name: Wyndham Garden Hotel Manhattan, Chelsea West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 7 nights at start of June. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was very comfortable and clean with good facilities. Hotel is located very close to two subway stations and for those who prefer to walk it is about 20mins from Times Square and an ideal location for exploring Chelsea and Greenwich!
reviews.title: Great hotel in ideal location

reviews.text: Stayed May 26-28 on a quick sightseeing trip to NYC. The room was small, but not so as to have any problem walking around the end of the bed or anything. I'm putting this in as the size of the room seems to be a concern to many reviewers, but, considering that the room was new and gorgeous with lovely amenities, I wouldn't pass on this place due to the size of the room.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was a subway ride from most tourist areas, but with 3 major lines within 1-3 blocks from the hotel, I bought a tourist pass and just took the subway all over the city. As a woman traveling alone, I felt safe walking from the subway to the hotel after evening shows around 11pm.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful - no complaints there.
reviews.title: Ok if you get a good price-I Did

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wouldn't hesitate staying there again.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights at the Wyndham Garden. It scored high on so many things - friendly staff (everyone!), comfy beds, very posh bedding and towels, extra towels and pillows, nice toiletries, lots of restaurants, convenient to walk to just about everywhere, loads of plusses! Our king room was big enough - fit a desk and chair and comfy chair without a problem. And we didn't need to move anything to walk around the bed. Unfortunately, they got dragged down by cleanliness. We had to ask for our room to be vacuumed ... from the previous tenant. And I'm sure it was not vacuumed daily. It really was close to perfect, but lack of good cleaning staff/policies really drags it down. I am clinging to the idea that these are teething pains, because I loved so much about it. We would probably stay again, because the front desk staff really helped get things cleaned up. I would just love if the management would back them up with a "clean daily" policy.
reviews.title: So close to 5 stars...

reviews.text: Stayed 7 days in Wyndham, had a double room and triple room, the triple room was a bit tight for space as we had 2 big beds in it but double was fine. Bathrooms are lovely and well stocked up with toiletries and towels, coffee maker in the room which was handy. Room was cleaned every day and a good job done. Good location there is a metro stop at the end of the road on Broadway with good connections and one the other end on 6th. Walking distance of macys but bit far to walk to times square. Clean hotel and the staff were all very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great location, very clean

reviews.text: The hotel was clean, and located well. But for 2 people, if we had to stay in the hotel room our entire stay we would have gone mad! Perfect for sleeping- and that's it.( The sheets were really really soft, and the mattress was quite comfy). I had to close our window curtains because I felt like I was going to fall out of the room.The bathroom was quite large, and it did have a nice flat screen tv. The employees were very friendly and helpful. Undecided if I'd stay here again. The price was good though, just so small.
reviews.title: Man, when they say small, they mean small!

reviews.text: When I stumbled in awkwardly with quite a few shopping bags, I was immediately greeted by the assistant general manager, Carlton. He was very friendly, professional in manners, and helpful (he even offered to bring my bags up for me). I didn't have reservations because it was a last minute overnight stay in the city. He set me up with a nice king size bed - in a quiet corner room. The bathroom was clean (stocked with bath and body products - one of my favorite brands), bed was extremely plush and comfortable, temperature was perfect (didn't need to adjust at all) and a 32 inch flat panel HD TV kept me entertained. I slept like a baby and checkout went smoothly in the morning. Before leaving, I had asked his staff for suggestions on great eats around the area (supplied me with quite a few options). This hotel even had a Starbucks, literally, a few feet from the elevators (perfect for my morning coffee addiction)!! Rates was reasonable for this stay, especially for a king size bed!
reviews.title: One word can sum my experience up - AMAZING!

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Wyndham Garden Hotel (Manhattan Chelsea West), which I booked through the internet.
reviews.title: A really nice hotel, in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Wyndham Garden in mid-June at a really great rate for NYC. The location is the best attribute of this hotel. Union Square, the Flatiron building, the Empire State building, Little India, and Penn Station are all withing reasonable walking distance. There are two subway stations on different lines within a block of the hotel. Plenty of options for meals, drinks, shopping, etc. Overall, Chelsea is very nice and much less touristy than Midtown.
reviews.title: Great Location, OK Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was just ok due to a few problems during our stay. We were given a clean room on the 6th floor on the back with the view of an airshaft. Free Wi-Fi was nice, but a little slow. The room was pretty small, but NYC generally has small rooms. We had a wardrobe for hanging clothes with an iron, ironing board inside and small coffee maker/set. One of the problems we had was a lack of any places to set anything down in the room (other than the floor). In the entire room, we only had one small nightstand. As a result, you have to try and sqeeze your wallet, keys, guidebook, map, subway card, drink, watch, remote control, clock, etc. on that one nightstand. I am not sure where you are supposed to actually MAKE the coffee. We tried making ours on the top of the toilet tank and on the floor. No closet. No desk or safe in the room although they are listed as amenities on the website. They did deliver a safe to go in our wardrobe when we requested it. I had to go to the front desk to get more shampoo and conditioner because they didn't give us anymore when they cleaned the room. The bed was the highpoint of the room itself. It was a large, King bed with nice linens and pillows.
reviews.title: At this price how can I complain?

reviews.text: During our stay, they were in the process of renovating the restaurant downstairs. As a result, we listened to hammers and banging if we were in the room during the day. As others have said, the shower design is terrible. It is impossible to shower and not get most of the bathroom floor wet.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful hotel
First "oh no!", then "oh yes!"
reviews.text: As referenced by a previous reviewer, the first morning we woke up at the Wyndham Garden there was no hot water. The staff apologized and suggested that it might be repaired soon, but we waited for a while and, in the end, took cold showers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the same price, I would probably stay at this hotel again and hope that the stay would be better. The location, cleanliness, and price is what would bring me back.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in New York City

reviews.text: This was a great hotel with a perfect location when visiting NYC! We stayed for 8 nights and were very impressed!
reviews.title: Great hotel! Would definitily stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean and room service came every day to clean/make beds/bring fresh towels. Was not impressed with the fitness room, but we weren't there to work out anyway. The room itself was on the smaller side, but that's expected in NYC. It was actually a decent size for NYC standards.
reviews.title: Poor customer services, comfortable beds

description: Free Wifi. Wyndham Garden Chelsea is located in Chelsea/Flatiron District. Chelsea is filled with chic art galleries, bars & clubs, world-famous restaurants, shopping and more. Guests are within walking distance to world-famous Manhattan attractions such as Madison Square Garden, Times Square, Macy’s/Herald Square, Empire State Building, Union Square and NYU. The hotel is one block from New York City’s subway system. The surrounding neighborhoods include Greenwich Village, Midtown and Gramercy.All rooms are smoke-free and include; MP3 & iPod connections, flat panel televisions, cordless phones, Wolfgang Puck in-room coffee and Herman Miler ergonomic desk chairs. Additionally, the hotel complimentary WiFi.
